class_notes:
(Permission of instructor is required.  Contact Dr. Nicole Gerardo at ngerard@emory.edu to request permission/receive permission number)
(Prerequisites:  Biology 141 + 141L)
(The required laboratory will meet  IN-PERSON)
(Course description:  Microbes shape the world we live in!  Come research fungal microbes and their interactions with the environment.  In this course, students will learn techniques necessary for culturing microbes and experimental design.  Students will propose a testable question and carry out the experiment.  In addition, students will learn aspects of research, such as data analysis and presenting results to other scientists and to the public.  We will also discuss how to find further research opportunities that match career goals)
course_description: Study of particular subjects pertaining to biology with laboratory or field experiences.  May be repeated for credit when topic varies.
